Description: Fragment of East Greek black-figured pottery lid; interior reserved; exterior slipped; at edge, interlinked double-dot band between bands, with added red; to centre, black-figure frieze, feline, to right, with circular filling ornament; on the edge of the rim vertical wavy lines alternating with dots. Glaze misfired to dusky red (7.5 R 3/2). Joins 9487
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
From the same piece as Alexandria 17250.
Venit: 'Strongly Corinthianizing although neither the clay, nor the color to which the glaze has been fired, speaks of Cortinthian.'
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 55 no. 190 pl. 45)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1156)
